body:
G'day! Thanks for the report. Any chance of a couple of pieces of extra info?
- When you say the third line throws an exception
  - what is the exception type?
  - stack trace?
  - does it escape the `Information` method? Serilog should handle any exceptions internally and never throw them out into the program, so if it is doing this we'd need to fix a bug :)
- Can you attach the output of Serilog's `SelfLog` as described here? https://github.com/serilog/serilog/wiki/Debugging-and-Diagnostics

Alternatively, if you can zip up and send me a repro (nblumhardt@ http://nblumhardt.com :)) I can do the legwork on these bits.

Regarding the scenario--

These are going to be pretty large (connected) objects to log, so you probably need to investigate custom destructuring policies - https://github.com/serilog/serilog/wiki/Structured-Data#customizing-the-stored-data

Irrespective of that though, your example as given should work.

Hi Nic,
It throws a System.Reflection.TargetInvocation exception with the message "Method may only be called on a Type for which Type.IsGenericParameter is true." I tried it with the CouchDb sink. In this case it writes the request object, but still throws an exception on the instanceContext line. I will send you the sample app soon.

The last few lines of the the self log exception file are given below.

```
Maximium destructuring depth reached.
Maximium destructuring depth reached.
Exception while emitting periodic batch from Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenDBSink: System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred. ---> System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenPropertyFormatter.Simplify(LogEventPropertyValue value)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectArrayIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Buffer`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 source)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToArray[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenPropertyFormatter.Simplify(LogEventPropertyValue value)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenPropertyFormatter.Simplify(LogEventPropertyValue value)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.Data.LogEvent..ctor(LogEvent logEvent, String renderedMessage)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenDBSink.<EmitBatchAsync>d__0.MoveNext()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait(Int32 millisecondsTimeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Wait()
   at Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.OnTick() in c:\Program Files\TeamCity\buildAgent\work\5c3517c45dd90804\src\Serilog.FullNetFx\Sinks\PeriodicBatching\PeriodicBatchingSink.cs:line 160
---> (Inner Exception #0) System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenPropertyFormatter.Simplify(LogEventPropertyValue value)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectArrayIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Buffer`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 source)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToArray[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenPropertyFormatter.Simplify(LogEventPropertyValue value)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenPropertyFormatter.Simplify(LogEventPropertyValue value)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.Data.LogEvent..ctor(LogEvent logEvent, String renderedMessage)
   at Serilog.Sinks.RavenDB.RavenDBSink.<EmitBatchAsync>d__0.MoveNext()<---
```
Just a quick question to add - are you running on .NET 4.5 or 4.0? Thanks again for the help, much appreciated!

Alrighty - some improvements in 1.1 of Serilog.nupkg, and 0.9.10 of the RavenDB sink should clear this one up.

There may still be some instances of the first problem lurking - when converting a dictionary for storage, type conversions might make the keys non-unique. Will keep an eye on it.

The second issue came from trying to destructure System.Type, which initially failed because many of its property get-accessors throw. Following on from that the breadth of its reference graph is so great that the only really useful way to serialize the is `.ToString()`, so that's effectively what we do now.

Let me know if you have any problems with the new version. Thanks again for the help! Nick

Thanks for looking into it Nick.

I've upgraded and finally had a chance to play around with it again. I am using the RavenDB sink version 0.9.10 and serilog version 1.2.3

I am still getting the issue where trying to log the request object isn't working and trying to log the instanceContext object throws a "Parameter count mismatch" exception.

I will play around a bit more to see if it's something I am doing wrong here.

Ok, thanks for the heads-up, I'll have a look again when I can too.

If you want to get up and running the best option is to transform these enormous non-serialization-friendly types to pluck out the properties you're interested in:

```
  // Logger configuration
  .Destructure.ByTransforming<InstanceContext>(ctx =>
    new { State = ctx.State, ...  })
```

The original goal for Serilog was only that it would _survive_ serialization of non-DTO types :) but I'd love to flush out any bugs or limitations lurking in there all the same!

BTW, the new version has PDBs embedded, so if you do hit an exception, pasting in another stack trace would be very helpful.

Cheers!
Nick

Ah- I see that I need to add PDBs to the RavenDB sink as well :)

Thanks for posting the trace, I'll have another shot at this!

Alrighty - fixed the RavenDB issue. The new (.NET 4.5) reflection APIs were too smart for me.... 1.2.4 of Serilog is now on NuGet.

I'm not sure about the "parameter count mismatch" - haven't managed to replicate it. Any more info/stack trace? Thanks again :)

Hi Nick,
Sorry about the late reply. It is reproducable in the sample solution I emailed you a while back. The serilog self log doesn't seem to only have `Maximium destructuring depth reached.` entries in it. Let me know if you can't reproduce the issue in that code and I will dig a little deeper  to see if I can isolate it more :-)
Hi Chai - think it is time I took a look at this with fresh eyes, will try to get some turnaround on it this week :) Thanks again!
Replicated, and pretty sure I've fixed this finally :) Thanks mate!
